intro: Acianthera cremasta, commonly known as the crested acianthera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, elongated, and often hairy stems. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some regions for horticultural purposes.
